page.title: 12Education-Comprehensive
page.content: { Secondary schools } In 1973 the existing secondary and Grammar schools were amalgamated forming St. Martin, St. Cennydd and St.Ilan Comprehensive Schools. St. Martin, a single site school, has 852 children and 53 staff. St. Ilan has a lower and upper school about 5Km. apart with 1029 children and 53 staff.Transfer between schools takes place at 13+. St. Cennydd, a single site school, has 953 children and 53 staff. A large number of the children are taken by bus to school. Subjects taught are wide ranging. "C.S.E.","O" and "A" level examinations are taken together with entrance examinations to Oxford and Cambridge Universities.
